ocms_parameter.description: This table contains parameter settings for various configuration options within the system.

ocms_shedlock.description: This table is used to manage distributed locking for scheduled tasks in the OCMS. This ensures that a scheduled task does not run simultaneously on multiple nodes in a distributed system, preventing race conditions and ensuring task consistency..

columns.description: Timestamp when the lock was created.

columns.name: cre_user_id
columns.description: ID of the user who created the lock.

columns.description: Timestamp until which the lock is valid.

columns.name: locked_at
columns.description: Timestamp when the lock was acquired.

columns.name: locked_by
columns.description: Identifier of the instance that acquired the lock.

columns.name: upd_date
columns.description: Last update timestamp of the lock entry.

columns.name: upd_user_id
columns.description: ID of the user who last updated the lock entry.

ocms_work_item.description: The table manages workflow items within an organization's intranet system, recording essential details like process type, status, and user interactions. It tracks creation and update timestamps, creator and updater IDs, and whether items have been read, ensuring efficient workflow tracking and user accountability.

columns.name: work_item_id
columns.description: Unique identifier for the work item.

columns.name: cre_date
columns.description: The date and time when the work item was created.

columns.name: cre_user_id
columns.description: The ID of the user who created the work item.

columns.name: is_read
columns.description: Indicates whether the work item has been read.

columns.description: The type of process associated with the work item.

columns.description: The date and time when the work item was last updated.

columns.name: upd_user_id
columns.description: The ID of the user who last updated the work item.

columns.name: work_item_title
columns.description: The title or description of the work item.

ocms_work_item_notices.description: The table tracks notices associated with work items in an organization's intranet system, detailing each notice's issue type, creation, and update information. It links notices to specific work items and records the identity of users involved in creating and updating these notices, facilitating efficient issue resolution and historical tracking

columns.name: notice_no
columns.description: Unique identifier for the notice.

columns.name: work_item_id
columns.description: Foreign key referencing ocms_work_item.work_item_id.

columns.name: cre_date
columns.description: The date and time when the notice entry was created.

columns.name: cre_user_id
columns.description: The ID of the user who created the notice entry.

columns.name: upd_date
columns.description: The date and time when the notice was last updated.

columns.name: upd_user_id
columns.description: The ID of the user who last updated the notice entry.

columns.name: issue_type
columns.description: The type of issue associated with the notice.

ocms_work_item_allocation.description: The table manages user assignments to specific work items within an organization's intranet system. It records the details of each allocation, including the associated user and work item, creation and update timestamps, and the identities of the users who performed these actions. This table is essential for tracking responsibility distribution and ensuring that updates to work item assignments are well-documented.

columns.name: user_id
columns.description: Unique identifier for the user assigned to the work item.

columns.name: work_item_id
columns.description: Foreign key referencing ocms_work_item.work_item_id.

columns.name: cre_date
columns.description: The date and time when the allocation entry was created.

columns.name: cre_user_id
columns.description: The ID of the user who created the allocation entry.

columns.name: upd_date
columns.description: The date and time when the allocation was last updated.

columns.name: upd_user_id
columns.description: The ID of the user who last updated the allocation entry.

ocms_suspended_notice.description: The table is used to record and manage suspensions related to compliance notices within an organization. It tracks details such as the reason for suspension, the officer responsible, and the dates of suspension and potential revival. This table is essential for maintaining accountability and ensuring that all suspensions are documented and managed systematically.

columns.name: notice_no
columns.description: The primary key and foreign key linking to Ivalidoffencenotice. Length restricted to 10 characters.

columns.name: date_of_suspension
columns.description: The primary key indicating the date when the suspension was applied. Length restricted to 7 characters.

columns.name: sr_no
columns.description: The primary key serial number identifying the suspension record. Length restricted to 7 characters.

columns.name: suspension_source
columns.description: Source of the suspension data. Length restricted to 8 characters.

columns.name: case_no
columns.description: Case number associated with the suspension.

columns.name: suspension_type
columns.description: Type of suspension. Length restricted to 2 characters.

columns.name: reason_of_suspension
columns.description: Reason code for the suspension. Length restricted to 3 characters.

columns.name: officer_authorising_suspension
columns.description: The officer's name or ID who authorized the suspension. Length restricted to 50 characters.

columns.name: due_date_of_revival
columns.description: The anticipated date when the suspension will be reviewed or lifted.

columns.name: suspension_remarks
columns.description: Remarks related to the suspension. Length restricted to 200 characters.

columns.name: date_of_revival
columns.description: Actual date when the suspension was lifted or resolved.

columns.name: revival_reason
columns.description: Reason for the revival of the suspension. Length restricted to 3 characters.

columns.name: officer_authorising_revival
columns.description: The officer's name or ID who authorized the revival. Length restricted to 50 characters.

columns.name: revival_remarks
columns.description: Remarks related to the revival of the suspension. Length restricted to 200 characters.

columns.name: process_indicator
columns.description: indicator for report to know this suspension coming from manual / cron process (e.g. manual/fetch_datahive_uen_fin/process_lta_rov_files)

columns.name: cre_date
columns.description: Creation date of the record. Automatically managed by the application.

columns.name: cre_user_id
columns.description: ID of the user who created the record. Length restricted to 50 characters.

columns.name: upd_date
columns.description: Last update date of the record. Automatically managed and updated by the application.

columns.name: upd_user_id
columns.description: ID of the user who last updated the record. Length restricted to 50 characters.
